File_Description: Geospatial data used to create flowlines for each river or stream.

The Global Aridity Index (Global-AI) and Global Reference Evapo-Transpiration (Global- ET0) datasets provided in Version 3 of the Global Aridity Index and Potential Evapo- Transpiration (ET0) Database (Global-AI_PET_v3) provide high-resolution (30 arc-seconds) global raster data for the 1970-2000 period related to evapotranspiration processes and rainfall deficit for potential vegetative growth; based upon implementation of the FAO-56 Penman- Monteith Reference Evapotranspiration (ET0) equation.

Scatter plot of percent difference of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) through time.

Mean responses of stream-chemistry (ln[response ratio]) as a function of climate classification Error Bars represent 95 percent confidence intervals. The numbers listed on the figure represent the "n-values" included within each climate classification. The colors correspond to the respective analyte. Data analysis was based on 16 publications.

Mean responses of stream-chemistry (ln[response ratio]) as a function of time since fire. Error Bars represent 95 percent confidence intervals. The numbers listed on the figure represent the "n-values" included within each time-since-fire bin. The colors correspond to the respective analyte. Data analysis was based on 18 publications.
Scatter plot of percent difference of nitrate (NO3) through time.
Boxplot of levene's test for dissolved organic carbon (DOC) for variability between time since fire buckets.
Boxplot of levene's test for dissolved organic carbon (DOC) for variability between climate buckets.

Mean responses of stream-chemistry (ln[response ratio]) as a function of percentage of the watershed burned for both nitrate (NO3) and dissolved organic carbon (DOC). Error Bars represent 95 percent confidence intervals. The numbers listed on the figure represent the "n-values" included within each burn percentage bin. The colors correspond to the respective analyte. Data analysis was based on 11 publications.
Boxplot of levene's test for nitrate (NO3) for variability between time since fire buckets.
Boxplot of levene's test for nitrate (NO3) for variability between climate buckets.
Histogram plot displaying the ratio between the size of the burned watershed with its reference counterpart.
Coefficient of variation (CV) for dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentration in burned and unburned watersheds included in the meta-analysis.
Yearly mean dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentration in burned and unburned watersheds included in the meta-analysis.
Coefficient of variation (CV) for nitrate (NO3) concentration in burned and unburned watersheds included in the meta-analysis.
Yearly mean nitrate (NO3) concentration in burned and unburned watersheds included in the meta-analysis.
Map showing all the studies represented in the manuscript.
Faceted bar plot showing the output of the random forest model.
